{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Confidential Secretary I",
  "description": "Federal University Gashua (FUGashua) is a university based in Yobe State, northeastern Nigeria.&nbsp;It is a learning and research institution that seeks to solve the immediate needs of society and give every person the opportunity to acquire knowledge.&nbsp;In its Education Sector reform and development, the Federal Government of Nigeria, in 2010, approved the establishment of twelve (12) universities in the six geopolitical zones of the country. This was to expand access to tertiary education for Nigerians.

Applications are invited from suitably qualified candidates to fill the academic position below:

Job Position: Confidential Secretary I

Job Location:&nbsp;Gashua, Yobe
Department: Registry

Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications.


General Requirements:


	Application is open to all eligible Nigerian citizens from the ages of 18 to 50 and are required to possess appropriate qualifications and competencies.
	NYSC discharge/exemption certificate and ICT proficiency are required.


Salary
CONTISS 7.

All applications should be made to:
The Registrar,
Federal University, Gashua,
P.M.B. 1005,
Gashua. Yobe State.

Application Procedure
Applicants are to register and submit their application letter, Curriculum Vitae and all suporting documents to the link above indicating the post applied for. The Curriculum Vitae should conatin the following:


	Full name in capital letters
	Post Desired
	Date of Birth
	Place of Birth
	State of Origin
	Local Government of Origin
	Nationality
	Permanent Home Address
	Current Postal Address
	Contact Address
	Phone Number
	Email Address
	Marital Status
	Institution(s) attended (with Dates)
	Academic qualifications (with dates) - attach photocopies of certificates
	Professional Qualifications (with dates) - attach photocopies of certificates
	Honours, Distinctions and Membership Professional Body(ies)
	Working Experience, Present Employment Status, salary and Employer
	Summary of research work and publications (where applicable)
	Details of Administrative Experience and Service to the Community, with details of status and dates
	Extra-Curricular Activities
	Names and Addresses of three (3) referees.
",

Confidential Secretary I Job at Federal University Gashua




        
    

        
        Federal University Gashua (FUGashua) is a university based in Yobe State, northeastern Nigeria. It is a learning and research institution that seeks to solve the immediate needs of society and give every person the opportunity to acquire knowledge. In its Education Sector reform and development, the Federal Government of Nigeria, in 2010, approved the establishment of twelve (12) universities in the six geopolitical zones of the country. This was to expand access to tertiary education for Nigerians.

Applications are invited from suitably qualified candidates to fill the academic position below:

Job Position: Confidential Secretary I

Job Location: Gashua, Yobe
Department: Registry
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications.


General Requirements:


	Application is open to all eligible Nigerian citizens from the ages of 18 to 50 and are required to possess appropriate qualifications and competencies.
	NYSC discharge/exemption certificate and ICT proficiency are required.


Salary
CONTISS 7.

All applications should be made to:
The Registrar,
Federal University, Gashua,
P.M.B. 1005,
Gashua. Yobe State.

Application Procedure
Applicants are to register and submit their application letter, Curriculum Vitae and all suporting documents to the link above indicating the post applied for. The Curriculum Vitae should conatin the following:


	Full name in capital letters
	Post Desired
	Date of Birth
	Place of Birth
	State of Origin
	Local Government of Origin
	Nationality
	Permanent Home Address
	Current Postal Address
	Contact Address
	Phone Number
	Email Address
	Marital Status
	Institution(s) attended (with Dates)
	Academic qualifications (with dates) - attach photocopies of certificates
	Professional Qualifications (with dates) - attach photocopies of certificates
	Honours, Distinctions and Membership Professional Body(ies)
	Working Experience, Present Employment Status, salary and Employer
	Summary of research work and publications (where applicable)
	Details of Administrative Experience and Service to the Community, with details of status and dates
	Extra-Curricular Activities
	Names and Addresses of three (3) referees.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant (Corper)",
  "description": "Reverse Aesthetics Limited is an integrated aesthetic and healthcare clinic established to provide comprehensive medical and cosmetic services. The company engages in the delivery of cosmetic procedures, including both surgical and non-surgical treatments, aimed at enhancing physical appearance and overall wellbeing.The clinic also offers general healthcare services, ensuring the promotion of preventive and curative health management. In addition, Reverse Aesthetics Limited undertakes hair transplant and restoration procedures, as well as dental cosmetic and general dental treatments, utilizing modern technology and professional expertise to ensure high standards of care and patient satisfaction.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant (Corper)
Job Location:&nbsp;Oniru - Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a competent, detail-oriented, and trustworthy Accountant to manage all financial and accounting operations of the clinic.
	The ideal candidate must be experienced in handling complete accounting books, tax remittances, and statutory compliance returns, while ensuring accurate financial reporting and proper internal controls.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Accounting &amp; Record Keeping:


	Manage all the clinic&rsquo;s accounting books, including general ledger, cashbook, accounts receivable, accounts payable, and expense tracking.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly financial updates for management.
	Maintain accurate documentation and filing of all financial records.
	Prepare and post journal entries, and ensure proper classification of transactions.


Tax Remittances &amp; Statutory Compliance:


	Handle all tax remittances, including VAT, PAYE, Withholding Tax, Company Income Tax, and other statutory obligations.
	Prepare and file compliance returns to relevant government authorities (FIRS, LIRS, pension bodies, etc.).
	Ensure the company complies with all regulatory and financial reporting requirements.
	Liaise with tax consultants, auditors, and regulatory bodies as required


Financial Reporting:


	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and management reports.
	Conduct variance analysis, financial forecasting, and budget monitoring.
	Provide data-driven insights to support management decisions.


Payroll Management:


	Manage timely and accurate payroll processing for all clinic staff.
	Ensure correct statutory deductions and remittances (PAYE, pension, NSITF, etc.).


Cashflow &amp; Budget Control:


	Monitor daily cash flow and prepare cashflow projections.
	Ensure proper documentation, authorization, and accountability of all expenditures.
	Assist in preparing annual budgets and ensure spending aligns with financial plans.


Internal Controls &amp; Financial Integrity:


	Implement strong accounting controls to safeguard the company&rsquo;s finances.
	Ensure compliance with all internal financial policies and standard operating procedures.
	Recommend improvements to financial systems and processes.
	Experience managing full accounting books and tax compliance is mandatory.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@reverseaesthetic.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as subject of the mail.

Note:&nbsp;Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-15",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Accountant (Corper) Job at Reverse Aesthetics Limited




        
    

        
        Reverse Aesthetics Limited is an integrated aesthetic and healthcare clinic established to provide comprehensive medical and cosmetic services. The company engages in the delivery of cosmetic procedures, including both surgical and non-surgical treatments, aimed at enhancing physical appearance and overall wellbeing.The clinic also offers general healthcare services, ensuring the promotion of preventive and curative health management. In addition, Reverse Aesthetics Limited undertakes hair transplant and restoration procedures, as well as dental cosmetic and general dental treatments, utilizing modern technology and professional expertise to ensure high standards of care and patient satisfaction.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant (Corper)
Job Location: Oniru - Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a competent, detail-oriented, and trustworthy Accountant to manage all financial and accounting operations of the clinic.
	The ideal candidate must be experienced in handling complete accounting books, tax remittances, and statutory compliance returns, while ensuring accurate financial reporting and proper internal controls.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Accounting & Record Keeping:


	Manage all the clinic’s accounting books, including general ledger, cashbook, accounts receivable, accounts payable, and expense tracking.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly financial updates for management.
	Maintain accurate documentation and filing of all financial records.
	Prepare and post journal entries, and ensure proper classification of transactions.


Tax Remittances & Statutory Compliance:


	Handle all tax remittances, including VAT, PAYE, Withholding Tax, Company Income Tax, and other statutory obligations.
	Prepare and file compliance returns to relevant government authorities (FIRS, LIRS, pension bodies, etc.).
	Ensure the company complies with all regulatory and financial reporting requirements.
	Liaise with tax consultants, auditors, and regulatory bodies as required


Financial Reporting:


	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and management reports.
	Conduct variance analysis, financial forecasting, and budget monitoring.
	Provide data-driven insights to support management decisions.


Payroll Management:


	Manage timely and accurate payroll processing for all clinic staff.
	Ensure correct statutory deductions and remittances (PAYE, pension, NSITF, etc.).


Cashflow & Budget Control:


	Monitor daily cash flow and prepare cashflow projections.
	Ensure proper documentation, authorization, and accountability of all expenditures.
	Assist in preparing annual budgets and ensure spending aligns with financial plans.


Internal Controls & Financial Integrity:


	Implement strong accounting controls to safeguard the company’s finances.
	Ensure compliance with all internal financial policies and standard operating procedures.
	Recommend improvements to financial systems and processes.
	Experience managing full accounting books and tax compliance is mandatory.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@reverseaesthetic.com using the Job Position as subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "At Talent Sync Services, we specialize in delivering tailored HR solutions to help businesses thrive. From recruitment and onboarding to performance management and compliance, we align talent strategies with organizational goals. Our commitment to excellence, personalized service, and innovative approaches ensures your workforce remains your greatest asset. Let us partner with you to unlock the full potential of your team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Technical Assistant to the MD / CEO

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a highly organised, detail-oriented, and forward-thinking Executive Technical Assistant to support the CEO.
	The ideal candidate will provide strategic, analytical, and administrative support, ensuring seamless execution of key initiatives and daily operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct research, prepare reports, and analyse data to support executive decision-making.
	Coordinate high-level meetings, presentations, and follow-up actions.
	Track and manage strategic projects, deadlines, and performance indicators.
	Draft professional correspondence, briefs, and executive summaries.

	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Excel, Word).
	Ability to multitask, prioritise, and work under pressure.

Technical Assistant to the MD / CEO Job at Talent Sync Services




        
    

        
        At Talent Sync Services, we specialize in delivering tailored HR solutions to help businesses thrive. From recruitment and onboarding to performance management and compliance, we align talent strategies with organizational goals. Our commitment to excellence, personalized service, and innovative approaches ensures your workforce remains your greatest asset. Let us partner with you to unlock the full potential of your team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Technical Assistant to the MD / CEO

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly organised, detail-oriented, and forward-thinking Executive Technical Assistant to support the CEO.
	The ideal candidate will provide strategic, analytical, and administrative support, ensuring seamless execution of key initiatives and daily operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct research, prepare reports, and analyse data to support executive decision-making.
	Coordinate high-level meetings, presentations, and follow-up actions.
	Track and manage strategic projects, deadlines, and performance indicators.
	Draft professional correspondence, briefs, and executive summaries.
	Serve as a liaison between the CEO and internal/external stakeholders.
	Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.
	Provide technical, analytical, and operational assistance as required.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Management, or related fields.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication, writing, and presentation skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Excel, Word).
	Ability to multitask, prioritise, and work under pressure.
	High level of professionalism and discretion.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talentsync1@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Graphic Designer",
  "description": "At Cowris Technologies, we bridge distances, connecting hearts through innovative financial solutions that are accessible and secure, empowering individuals and businesses on their financial journeys.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphic Designer

Job Location:&nbsp;&nbsp;Lagos

Job Summary


	We&#39;re seeking a Graphics Designer with 5 years of experience in creating stunning visuals for digital media.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong portfolio showcasing their expertise in
	image editing, video graphics editing, and animation using modern design tools and technologies.
	As a Graphics Designer, you&#39;ll work closely with our Product Portfolio Manager, Digital Marketing Manager, and Community Engagement Coordinator to develop and execute a visual content, ensuring consistency and alignment with our brand guidelines.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and produce high-quality graphics, animations, and videos for social and digital media communities
	Create engaging visual content for websites, social media, and marketing campaigns
	Develop and maintain brand guidelines, including logos, color schemes, typography, and imagery
	Collaborate with the Digital Marketing Manager to develop and execute social media campaigns
	Work with the Product Portfolio Manager to design and optimize website content
	Create visual elements, such as icons, illustrations, and infographics
	Edit and retouch images and videos using modern design tools and technologies
	Stay up-to-date with the latest design trends and technologies
	Perform other duties as assigned by management, particularly in areas related to branding and marketing communications, to support company growth and objectives


Requirements


	5 years of experience in graphics design, with a focus on digital media
	Strong portfolio showcasing expertise in image editing, video graphics editing, and animation
	Proficiency in modern design tools and technologies, including Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, After Effects)
	Experience with motion graphics, animation, and video editing
	Strong understanding of branding and marketing principles
	Excellent communication and project management skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Familiarity with fintech or payment solutions is an asset, but not required


What We Offer


	Competitive salary range: N70,000 - N125,000 monthly.
	Employee benefits package
	Opportunities for growth and professional development
	Collaborative and dynamic work environment
	Flexible work hours and remote work options
	The chance to shape the future of our brand and drive business growth


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to:&nbsp;hr@cowris.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Application &ndash; [Job Position]&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

Graphic Designer Job at Cowris Technologies




        
    

        
        At Cowris Technologies, we bridge distances, connecting hearts through innovative financial solutions that are accessible and secure, empowering individuals and businesses on their financial journeys.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphic Designer

Job Location:  Lagos

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We're seeking a Graphics Designer with 5 years of experience in creating stunning visuals for digital media.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong portfolio showcasing their expertise in
	image editing, video graphics editing, and animation using modern design tools and technologies.
	As a Graphics Designer, you'll work closely with our Product Portfolio Manager, Digital Marketing Manager, and Community Engagement Coordinator to develop and execute a visual content, ensuring consistency and alignment with our brand guidelines.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and produce high-quality graphics, animations, and videos for social and digital media communities
	Create engaging visual content for websites, social media, and marketing campaigns
	Develop and maintain brand guidelines, including logos, color schemes, typography, and imagery
	Collaborate with the Digital Marketing Manager to develop and execute social media campaigns
	Work with the Product Portfolio Manager to design and optimize website content
	Create visual elements, such as icons, illustrations, and infographics
	Edit and retouch images and videos using modern design tools and technologies
	Stay up-to-date with the latest design trends and technologies
	Perform other duties as assigned by management, particularly in areas related to branding and marketing communications, to support company growth and objectives


Requirements


	5 years of experience in graphics design, with a focus on digital media
	Strong portfolio showcasing expertise in image editing, video graphics editing, and animation
	Proficiency in modern design tools and technologies, including Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, After Effects)
	Experience with motion graphics, animation, and video editing
	Strong understanding of branding and marketing principles
	Excellent communication and project management skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Familiarity with fintech or payment solutions is an asset, but not required


What We Offer


	Competitive salary range: N70,000 - N125,000 monthly.
	Employee benefits package
	Opportunities for growth and professional development
	Collaborative and dynamic work environment
	Flexible work hours and remote work options
	The chance to shape the future of our brand and drive business growth


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to: hr@cowris.com using “Application – [Job Position]” as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Account Officer",
  "description": "Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Manufacturing

Job Summary


	The Account Officer will support the Accounts &amp; Finance Department in maintaining accurate financial records, managing payables and receivables, ensuring compliance with tax regulations, and assisting with inventory reconciliation and ERP processes.
	The ideal candidate must be detail-oriented, analytical, and able to work effectively under tight deadlines.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Accounting &amp; Reporting:


	Record all financial transactions (sales, purchases, payments, receipts, journal entries) in the ERP system promptly.
	Prepare monthly bank reconciliations in the ERP system.
	Assist in preparing weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual management reports.
	Support inter-company reconciliation activities.


Payables &amp; Receivables Management:


	Verify supplier invoices, payment vouchers, and related supporting documents.
	Obtain necessary approvals from authorized signatories.
	Prepare bank payment instructions.
	Assist in compiling weekly debtors&rsquo; reports.
	Prepare vendor payable summaries, maintain advance payment records, and follow up with team members for timely purchase booking and proper documentation.


Compliance &amp; Audit Support:


	Prepare VAT, WHT, PAYE, and Pension schedules and ensure timely remittances.
	Properly file documents for audit purposes.
	Support external auditors during audit exercises by providing required documentation.


Inventory:


	Conduct monthly physical stock counts and reconcile raw materials, finished goods, and WIP with production and warehouse teams.


ERP &amp; Process Improvement:


	Support periodic system reconciliations between Tally and eResource ERP during the migration phase.


Requirements


	Minimum of 1 year of experience in the Accounting field.
	Strong understanding of accounting principles.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and accounting software (Tally / eResource ERP).
	Familiarity with Nigerian tax regulations (VAT, WHT, CIT, etc.).
	Ability to work effectively under tight timelines.
	Strong coordination and communication skills to work with various departments.&yen;


Salary
N200,000 / month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;cv@ascentech.com.ng&nbsp;using &ldquo;Account Officer &ndash; Ilupeju&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-28",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Ascentech Services Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {

Account Officer Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location: ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Manufacturing

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Account Officer will support the Accounts & Finance Department in maintaining accurate financial records, managing payables and receivables, ensuring compliance with tax regulations, and assisting with inventory reconciliation and ERP processes.
	The ideal candidate must be detail-oriented, analytical, and able to work effectively under tight deadlines.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Accounting & Reporting:


	Record all financial transactions (sales, purchases, payments, receipts, journal entries) in the ERP system promptly.
	Prepare monthly bank reconciliations in the ERP system.
	Assist in preparing weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual management reports.
	Support inter-company reconciliation activities.


Payables & Receivables Management:


	Verify supplier invoices, payment vouchers, and related supporting documents.
	Obtain necessary approvals from authorized signatories.
	Prepare bank payment instructions.
	Assist in compiling weekly debtors’ reports.
	Prepare vendor payable summaries, maintain advance payment records, and follow up with team members for timely purchase booking and proper documentation.


Compliance & Audit Support:


	Prepare VAT, WHT, PAYE, and Pension schedules and ensure timely remittances.
	Properly file documents for audit purposes.
	Support external auditors during audit exercises by providing required documentation.


Inventory:


	Conduct monthly physical stock counts and reconcile raw materials, finished goods, and WIP with production and warehouse teams.


ERP & Process Improvement:


	Support periodic system reconciliations between Tally and eResource ERP during the migration phase.


Requirements


	Minimum of 1 year of experience in the Accounting field.
	Strong understanding of accounting principles.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and accounting software (Tally / eResource ERP).
	Familiarity with Nigerian tax regulations (VAT, WHT, CIT, etc.).
	Ability to work effectively under tight timelines.
	Strong coordination and communication skills to work with various departments.¥


Salary
N200,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using “Account Officer – Ilupeju” as the subject of the mail.
